events.title: Syria, once home to a large Jewish community, takes steps to return property to Jews
events.summary: A Jewish heritage foundation has set out to help restore private property appropriated after Syrian Jews left the country.

events.title: The U.K. investigates its ex-ambassador to the U.S. over alleged leaks to Epstein
events.summary: The U.K. government says newly released files related to Jeffrey Epstein suggest that the former British ambassador to the U.S. may have shared market-sensitive information with Epstein.

events.title: Paris prosecutors raid X offices as part of investigation into child abuse images
events.summary: The prosecutors raided the offices of X as part of a preliminary investigation into allegations including spreading child sexual abuse images and deepfakes. They also summoned owner Elon Musk for questioning.

events.title: Takeaways from the latest Epstein files. And, police search for Savannah Guthrie's mom
events.summary: NPR analyzes the latest Jeffrey Epstein files. And, Arizona authorities launched an urgent search for Savannah Guthrie's 84-year-old mother, Nancyafter a suspected home abduction.

events.title: Trump says he will lower tariffs on India to 18%
events.summary: President Trump says that he has agreed to a trade deal with India --- which will lower tariffs on the country to 18%.

events.title: Iranians seeking to punish ruling elite go after the next best thing -- their kids
events.summary: Iranians in the diaspora are tracking down the sons and daughters of Iran's ruling elite, many of whom work and live lavishly abroad, demanding they be deported.

events.title: Gaza's Rafah border crossing reopens, but few have been allowed to cross
events.summary: Gaza's main border crossing reopened Monday after being closed for most of the war, but few people have been allowed to cross.

events.title: U.S. and Iran to meet for negotiations over Iran's nuclear program
events.summary: The U.S. and Iran will meet later this week in Turkey to discuss Iran's nuclear program. The negotiations come after President Trump weighed military strikes on Iran.

events.title: What to know to know ahead of the negotiations between U.S. and Iran
events.summary: NPR's Michel Martin asks Suzanne Maloney, vice president and director of the foreign policy program at the Brookings Institution, about U.S. negotiations with Iran.

events.title: Trevi Fountain fee takes effect as Rome seeks to manage tourist crowds
events.summary: Tourists hoping to get close to the Trevi Fountain had to pay 2 euros starting Monday as the city of Rome inaugurated a new fee structure to help raise money and control crowds.

events.title: Migrant boat collides with Greek coast guard vessel, 15 dead
events.summary: According to media reports, the Greek patrol boat issued a warning signal after spotting the migrant boat, which then tried to escape. For reasons that are still unclear, the two boats collided.

events.title: US: Trump signs bill ending partial government shutdown
events.summary: The budget package secures funding for most US government agencies until the end of September, except for the Department of Homeland Security.

events.title: NATO sets Arctic mission plans in motion
events.summary: The move comes after Donald Trump stepped back on his insistence that the US must control Greenland to ensure national security. Greenland has warned the US still wants to control the strategic Arctic island.

events.title: Iran signals willingness for nuclear talks with US
events.summary: Iran's president has issued the clearest indication he'd like to enter renewed nuclear talks with the US and others. But this comes amid mixed diplomatic messages, large anti-government protests, and maritime tensions.

events.title: Germany and the Gulf region: Energy and arms deals
events.summary: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz is visiting three Gulf states within just 72 hours. He is pursuing new "strategic partnerships" — as Germany's friendship with the United States is becoming increasingly fragile.

events.title: World Cancer Day: Smoking, infections and alcohol cause 4 in 10 preventable cancer cases
events.summary: A new WHO study suggests more than 7 million cases of cancer in 2022 were preventable. Nearly 40% of all the cases that year were caused by modifiable risk factors — behavioral and environmental factors we can change.

events.title: Pieces of the Berlin Wall as souvenirs: Fake or the real deal?
events.summary: It's been nearly 40 years since the fall of the Berlin Wall but you can still buy pieces of it in the German capital as souvenirs. Are they genuine?

events.title: Trump hails 'very good' meeting with Colombia's Petro
events.summary: Petro's visit comes as Trump has accused him of pumping cocaine into the US, while the Colombian leader has been a vocal critic of US actions in Venezuela. But the meeting seemed to go far better than expected.

events.title: UK: Peter Mandelson to quit House of Lords over Epstein ties
events.summary: New releases from the Epstein files show the former Labour Party politician shared political information with the convicted sex offender. Police are reviewing reports of misconduct.

events.title: Uhlaender low on Olympic options after CAS appeal fails
events.summary: Katie Uhlaender says she was unfairly denied the chance to reach her sixth Winter Olympics by rivals Canada. The top sports court has now blocked the US skeleton athlete's latest effort to compete.

events.title: Pakistan: Security in Balochistan hits new low
events.summary: A recent series of terror attacks in Balochistan, a mineral-rich region of Pakistan struggling with a separatist insurgency, poses a grave challenge to Islamabad.

events.title: Witnesses tell DW how recent mass demonstrations in Iran escalated into deadly clashes.
events.summary: In an exclusive report from inside Iran, witnesses told DW how recent mass demonstrations escalated into deadly clashes.

events.title: India's oil shake-up: Can Venezuela really replace Russia?
events.summary: Donald Trump says India has agreed to replace Russian oil with US supplies — and maybe even Venezuelan. DW asks whether the Latin American producer can realistically meet New Delhi's needs.

events.title: Vietnam boosts EU partnership to match ties to China, US
events.summary: The EU agreed to a "Comprehensive Strategic Partnership" with Vietnam, its biggest trading partner in Southeast Asia, during Antonio Costa's visit to Hanoi. But Russia, China and the US have all gotten there first.

events.title: Ultra-processed foods 'engineered' like cigarettes: study
events.summary: A new study has drawn parallels between the addictive qualities of ultra-processed foods (UPFs) and tobacco products and called for similar levels of regulation.

events.title: Australia: Teen swims for hours to save family lost at sea
events.summary: The 13-year-old boy braved rough seas to reach the shore and raise the alarm; rescuers then found his mother and siblings. The family were on kayaks and paddleboards when winds picked up and dragged them out to sea.

events.title: France: Police raid X offices in Paris, summon Elon Musk
events.summary: The office raid comes amid an ongoing investigation into the platform's AI chatbot posting Holocaust denial and sexualized images of women and children.

events.title: How can Africa cash in on the gold rush?
events.summary: Soaring gold prices have sent African nations that produce the precious metal scrambling to capitalize on the surge. But can they adjust quickly enough?

events.title: FIFA boss Infantino wants Russia to return to football
events.summary: In a surprise statement, the head of world football has said he believes it is time for Russia to return to the pitch.

events.title: Indian trade deal provides opportunity for German carmakers
events.summary: Up until now, German cars have barely penetrated the Indian market despite success elsewhere. Could the new EU-India trade deal be a game changer for the struggling sector?

events.title: Why gold and silver prices suddenly collapsed
events.summary: After hitting record highs last week, the prices of gold and silver have suddenly reversed course. DW looks at how a euphoric rally flipped into a sharp, confidence-shaking rout.

events.title: France's 2026 budget finally gets passed
events.summary: Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu's minority government made it through two no-confidence votes before finally getting his 2026 budget over the line.

events.title: How a heckled Canadian became Germany's Olympic hockey coach
events.summary: Harold Kreis is set to head to his first Olympic Games as coach of the German men's ice hockey team. Now a legend of the game in his adopted homeland, he wasn't welcomed by all when he first arrived from Canada.

events.title: Vienna swaps parking for green space
events.summary: Conscious of reaching climate goals and strapped for space, some cities are reconsidering how much they dedicate to parking. Austria's capital, Vienna, is streets ahead.

events.title: Trump's Greenland 'piece of ice' remark echoes history
events.summary: Donald Trump's description of Greenland echoes a colonial pattern in which powerful states have dismissed sparsely populated land, ignoring Indigenous ties.

events.title: Germany news: Nationwide strikes hit public transport
events.summary: Many buses, trams and underground trains across the country will not be running amid a strike by a large union. Foreign Minister Wadephul is visiting Singapore. Read more in DW's running coverage of German news.

events.title: Tens of thousands back Czech president amid cabinet dispute
events.summary: A large rally in Prague showed support for Czech President Petr Pavel, who accused the country's top diplomat of blackmail. The row centers on Pavel's refusal to appoint a controversial candidate as environment minister.

events.title: Handball: Germany lose to Denmark in Euro final
events.summary: Germany fell at the final hurdle at the European Men's Handball Championship, losing to co-hosts and favorites Denmark in the final. Two German players made the tournament all-star team.

events.title: Turkey's textile industry in crisis
events.summary: Shuttered factories and lost jobs: Turkey's textile industry is fighting for its life. Exports are dwindling as China and Bangladesh conquer EU markets. Those affected say they don't have much hope for the future.

events.title: Trilateral Ukraine peace talks delayed after US, Russia meet
events.summary: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has announced that the dates for the next US-Ukraine-Russia talks are set for February 4-5 in Abu Dhabi. Meanwhile, 12 Ukrainian miners were ⁠killed in a Russian drone strike on a bus.

events.title: Rita Süssmuth: The high-profile feminist reformer dies aged 88
events.summary: She dared to break taboos, advocated for women's rights and took part in a failed attempt to oust Chancellor Helmut Kohl as chairman of the CDU. Former President of the German Bundestag Rita Süssmuth has died aged 88.

events.title: Germany news: Energy cooperation with Saudi Arabia to expand
events.summary: During a visit to Riyadh, Germany's Economy Minister Katherina Reiche said companies from the two countries will work together to strengthen the ties between them.

events.title: Germany: Afghanistan's consulates pose threat to refugees
events.summary: Afghanistan's consulates in Germany are being taken over by Taliban officials, putting Afghan people at the mercy of the regime they fled.

events.title: Epstein files: UK PM Starmer says ex-prince Andrew should testify in US
events.summary: A new batch of Epstein files has ratcheted up the heat on Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor over his links with the pedophile financier. Now, the British PM says the former prince should testify in the US Congress.

events.title: The hidden money behind deep-sea mining
events.summary: A DW investigation traces the hidden financial web behind deep-sea mining — an industry scientists say remains poorly understood, yet capable of causing irreversible harm to oceans worldwide.

events.title: Belarus: Snow and cold used to torture political prisoners
events.summary: Former political prisoners tell DW that winter in Belarus prisons is brutal during cold, snowy winters like this one — because snow and freezing temperatures are used by guards to torment them.

events.title: An undying trend: How vampires like those in 'Sinners' hold a mirror to society
events.summary: As the horror movie "Sinners" stands poised to sweep the Oscars, we take a look at how and why the vampire genre has long captivated audiences — from folklore to film. Is this trend truly immortal?

events.title: Italy church restoration probed after Meloni angel lookalike
events.summary: Many have noted a striking resemblance between the face of an angel in a restored church in Rome and that of Italy's prime minister. "No, decidedly I do not resemble an angel," Giorgia Meloni has said.

events.title: Denmark: Thousands take part in veteran anti-Trump protest
events.summary: The silent march to the US embassy in Copenhagen came after Donald Trump belittled NATO's role in the Afghanistan war. Tensions remain high between the two NATO allies amid Trump's push to acquire Greenland.

events.title: Massive outage knocks out power across Ukraine, Moldova
events.summary: Disruptions to Ukraine's power grid have led to outages there and in neighboring Moldova. Kyiv's metro and water supply have both been affected.

events.title: Germany's AfD bonds with Austrian far-right extremists
events.summary: Officials from the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) party have been openly rubbing shoulders with Austrian right-wing extremist Martin Sellner. This, despite reservations over his Identitarian Movement.

events.title: Canadian actress Catherine O'Hara dies at 71
events.summary: Catherine O'Hara was famous for starring roles in the series "Schitt's Creek" and the "Home Alone" movies. She got her start with the Second City Toronto comedy troupe in the 1970s before her career in Hollywood.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Kremlin says Trump asked Putin not to hit Kyiv until Feb. 1
events.summary: The Kremlin announced that US President Donald Trump had asked Vladimir Putin to halt strikes on Kyiv until February 1. However, Ukraine reported that Russia launched one missile and over 100 drones overnight. Follow DW.

events.title: Germany news: Hamburg police investigating subway deaths
events.summary: Police in the city of Hamburg are probing a suspected homicide after two people were hit by an underground train. Meanwhile, a survey has found that many Germans who work part-time do so voluntarily. DW has more.

events.title: EU asylum policy: What changes for refugees in Germany?
events.summary: The German government is about to implement the EU's Common European Asylum System (CEAS) to limit irregular migration and speed up asylum procedures.

events.title: Czechia's feud between president and government intensifies
events.summary: Relations between Czech President Petr Pavel and Foreign Minister Petr Macinka have almost completely broken down. With Prime Minister Andrej Babis backing Macinka, the rift between president and government is growing.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Fun events, but what about the bill?
events.summary: Preparations for the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan and Cortina have been far from perfect. Should the Olympics hosting model be changed?

events.title: Cyprus to Greenland: Could UK military bases guide US moves?
events.summary: Following recent reports that President Trump may be interested in establishing US military bases in Greenland along the lines of British Sovereign Base Areas in Cyprus, DW looks at the history and status of these bases.

events.title: Ukraine at war: Battered by Russia and winter but unbending
events.summary: Russian attacks, biting cold, and heat and power outages are grinding Ukrainians down. But polls show a society sticking together under fire and one unwilling to compromise with Russia.

events.title: Can the EU take on Musk over AI 'undressing' feature?
events.summary: The EU is probing Elon Musk's Grok AI after its deepfake feature generated millions of sexualized images of women and children. Brussels is putting its toughest tech laws to one of their biggest test yet.

events.title: Ukraine: Trump says Putin agreed not to hit Kyiv for 1 week
events.summary: President Donald Trump has said Russia's Vladimir Putin "agreed" not to strike the capital for a week with a harsh cold snap forecast. Russia routinely targets Ukraine's electricity supply. Follow DW.

events.title: Trial against German Carnival satirist Tilly underway in Russia
events.summary: Jacques Tilly's Carnival floats mocking Vladimir Putin have landed him before a Moscow court. As the trial drags on, the Dusseldorf-based satirist has denounced the charges as an assault on freedom of expression.

events.title: Silver: Why the price of 'poor man's gold' has hit a record
events.summary: The price of silver has just reached an all-time high of more than $120 per ounce. Although gold has eclipsed the white metal as a store of value, DW explores why silver is regaining global relevance.

events.title: Germany's Bundeswehr goes on military spending spree
events.summary: Germany is spending more on weapons and military equipment than ever before. For the first time, this also includes combat drones.

events.title: Anti-woke Germans in Russia used as propaganda for Putin
events.summary: Media in Moscow are selling a narrative of mass Western migration to Russia, especially from Germany. Numbers contradict the Kremlin's claims.

events.title: Trump tariffs, dollar's dip a double-hit to eurozone exports
events.summary: The euro has reached its highest level against the US dollar since 2021. That has consequences for eurozone companies and consumers, but few think that the European Central Bank should intervene yet.

events.title: Senegal and Morocco fined and banned after AFCON final chaos
events.summary: Africa's governing football body has issued more than $1 million in fines after the chaotic scenes at the end of the AFCON final. In addition, a number of players and Senegal's coach face bans.

events.title: Why fans are obsessed with 'Bridgerton'
events.summary: Opulent romance, a diverse cast and plotlines that meld fairytales with a modern zeitgeist: "Bridgerton" has redefined the period-piece genre.

events.title: Heating with air conditioning saves on cost and cuts CO2
events.summary: From Japan to China and the US to Scandinavia, heating with air conditioning has long been standard practice. But now warming homes with AC is catching on in other parts of the world.

events.title: UK's Keir Starmer visits China as Beijing courts US allies
events.summary: Keir Starmer is in China for the first trip by a British prime minister since 2018. He is the latest in a string of European leaders to visit recently, with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz soon to follow.

events.title: Tesla profit slumps amid lower EV sales, AI spending surge
events.summary: With increased competition and heavy attention on the antics of the company's CEO, Tesla's core electric vehicle business has faltered in the past year.

events.title: German development policy: Partners in the Global South
events.summary: The Federal Minister for Economic Cooperation and Development is focusing on solidarity and partnership in turbulent geopolitical times. Alabali Radovan's trip to Sierra Leone in West Africa illustrates what this means.

events.title: Budapest mayor charged over Pride parade
events.summary: Prosecutors in Hungary are moving against Budapest’s mayor, Gergely Karacsony, after last year's Pride went ahead despite a police ban. The case is being handled without a court hearing and as elections approach.

events.title: Arctic scientists 'feel pretty uncomfortable' on Greenland
events.summary: Science in the Arctic — and Greenland — is on the frontline of pressing challenges facing humanity, like climate change and genetics. Some researchers worry international collaboration is at risk.

events.title: CDU, Merz target 'lifestyle part-time' work in Germany
events.summary: A proposal from the economic wing of Germany’s CDU to place tighter restrictions on part-time contracts has come under heavy scrutiny. Chancellor Merz has repeatedly criticized the German work ethic in the past year.

events.title: Amazon cuts more corporate jobs in post-pandemic downsize
events.summary: Amazon told employees that it was cutting 16,000 corporate jobs, completing a downsizing move that began last year. The online retail giant had recruited during a COVID pandemic spike in demand.

events.title: Environmental crises add to Iran's mounting troubles
events.summary: Widespread discontent in Iran has sent millions of protesters into the streets. Poor environmental planning embodies one of the government's most existential vulnerabilities.

events.title: How Germany's skilled worker gap exposes migration hurdles
events.summary: Germany is facing a massive shortage of skilled workers, from nurses to IT specialists. The country needs hundreds of thousands of professionals, but bureaucracy and political hurdles are slowing recruitment abroad.

events.title: What 'banana republic' means — and why its history matters
events.summary: From plantations to political rhetoric, the term's evolution shows how a violent past can fade into metaphor, sometimes obscuring its true history.

events.title: How does Germany deport people?
events.summary: Germany does not have masked ICE officers or an equivalent agency, but both Chancellor Friedrich Merz and his predecessor have done all they can to accelerate deportations. Here's how the process works.

events.title: FIFA ex-President Blatter backs call to boycott World Cup
events.summary: With the US due to co-host the football World Cup this summer, former FIFA President Sepp Blatter said a former colleague was "right" to advise supporters to "stay home" and watch on TV amid an immigration crackdown.

events.title: Germany's Green Party under pressure over Mercosur vote
events.summary: The Greens are big supporters of international agreements. But, now, eight German lawmakers in the European Parliament have all but scuppered the Mercosur free trade agreement — defying their party's leadership.

events.title: Protests in Iran: Ali Karimi leads sports' call for support
events.summary: Former Iran and Bayern Munich footballer Ali Karimi has signed an open letter, asking FIFA to act. He is not the only athlete to be vocal.

events.title: Plastic emissions could double health damage by 2040
events.summary: Plastic pollution could double its harm to human health in the coming decades if current production trends continue, according to a new study that links rising risks directly to the manufacture of new plastics.

events.title: IOC rejects extra Winter Olympics spot for skeleton's Uhlaender
events.summary: IOC President Kirsty Coventry had been asked to intervene after Katie Uhlaender was the victim of alleged competition manipulation, causing her to miss out on February's Winter Olympics.

events.title: German FA boss says World Cup boycott would be 'misguided'
events.summary: At the first DFL meeting of 2026, German FA boss Bernd Neuendorf spoke for the first time about a World Cup boycott.

events.title: Holocaust survivor Leon Weintraub: "We were dehumanized"
events.summary: The 100-year-old vividly recalls the hunger, death camps and cruelty of the guards. Thus, he tirelessly works to ensure that the Holocaust is never forgotten.

events.title: Paris Agreement 10 years on: More wins than you may realize
events.summary: Major emitter the US has officially left the Paris Agreement and global emissions keep rising a decade on from the deal. Yet renewables' growth shows climate action can work. Here's what's been done and what's missing.

events.title: Australian Open tennis encounters extreme heat
events.summary: Tournament organizers have instituted their extreme heat protocols amid blistering temperatures in the region.

events.title: Ye aka Kanye West apologizes for antisemitic remarks
events.summary: The artist previously known as Kanye West blamed his behavior on bipolar disorder, saying he "lost touch with reality."

events.title: Berlin's young Jews reveal complex experiences with antisemitism
events.summary: Jewish people in Berlin have had varying experiences since October 7, 2023, but several DW spoke to say they have seen more antisemitism and have become increasingly cautious.

events.title: Germany, France, others rebuke Trump's NATO troop disrespect
events.summary: German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius said it would show "decency" for Donald Trump to apologize for comments on NATO troops in Afghanistan. "But we all know how the US president operates," Pistorius added.

events.title: Gold breaks $5,000: What's fueling the price rally and where will it end?
events.summary: Gold continues to hit record highs, having already had a bumper run in 2025. Geopolitical and economic uncertainty are the key factors, while doubts over the US dollar are also attracting new investors.

events.title: EU pushes for deals as Trump's tariffs upset global trade
events.summary: Fear over Trump's tariff walls and the aggressive tone coming from the White House is pushing the European Union to focus on getting other trade agreements done. Despite all efforts, the EU sometimes gets in its own way.

events.title: Germany: Business index starts year with 'little momentum'
events.summary: Germany's Ifo business barometer was stagnant in January, bucking predictions of a slight improvement. A dip in confidence in the service sector put the brakes on improved sentiments in other areas.

events.title: Germany news: Bounty offered over Berlin power grid attack
events.summary: German authorities have offered a €1 million bounty for tips related to this month's massive Berlin blackout. Meanwhile, European leaders discussed energy and security cooperation in Hamburg. DW has more.

events.title: Calls grow for European teams to boycott World Cup 2026
events.summary: As with Russia in 2018 and Qatar in 2022, politics are dominating the buildup to North America's 2026 World Cup. Could discontent with Donald Trump in Europe see football heavyweights unite to boycott the tournament?

events.title: US–EU economic ties show why neither side can decouple
events.summary: Despite a pause in tariff escalation, US–EU trade remains volatile under Donald Trump. From deficits and energy to services and the dollar, the trans-Atlantic relationship reveals deep ties — and clear vulnerabilities.

events.title: Blood supplies running low in Germany
events.summary: A shortage of blood donations in Germany could have dramatic consequences. The situation was critical in mid-January. DW's Marcel Fürstenau answered a call to donate blood and reported on his experience.

events.title: Germany weighs boon and bane of China's industrial expansion
events.summary: From cheap exports to cutting-edge tech: A Chinese battery giant's secretive factory in Germany shows how "Made in China" and "Made in Germany" are colliding — and where they can benefit from each other.

events.title: Merz says Germany won't join Trump's 'Board of Peace'
events.summary: German Chancellor Merz said the current form of US President Trump's "Board of Peace" prevented Germany from joining for "constitutional reasons." But Merz said he was open to "new formats" of cooperation with the US.

events.title: 'Sweet Caroline' singer Neil Diamond turns 85
events.summary: He was a pop icon in the 1970s. Today, one of his songs is experiencing a viral resurgence. From soccer stadiums to TikTok, Neil Diamond's "Sweet Caroline" hasn't stopped playing.

events.title: Germany investigates Russian espionage case
events.summary: After identifying a suspected agent, Germany has expelled a Russian embassy employee and summoned the Russian ambassador.

events.title: Former Scorpions bassist, Francis Buchholz, dies aged 71
events.summary: The musician's family said he died following a battle with cancer. Buchholz played bass for the Scorpions rock band until 1992, during one of their most successful periods.

events.title: Rodman becomes new 'highest paid' women's footballer
events.summary: USA forward Trinity Rodman has re-signed with the Washington Spirit of the National Women's Soccer League in a deal that will reportedly pay her in excess of $2 million per season.

events.title: Trump, Zelenskyy, Carney dominate Davos 2026: As it happened
events.summary: The World Economic Forum has come to an end after a tense but ultimately anti-climactic week at Davos, with the US, Ukrainian and Canadian leaders attracting the most attention. Read DW's wrap of the summit.

events.title: Germany: Nord Stream suspect cannot claim immunity
events.summary: German judges have nixed an appeal by a Ukrainian national suspected of helping blow up an underwater gas pipeline to be freed from prosecution. Neighboring Poland is refusing to extradite his alleged co-conspirator.

events.title: Can China rely on domestic oil after Iran, Venezuela shocks?
events.summary: Donald Trump's moves against two key suppliers have revived debate over China’s fragile oil balance. With domestic output flat and oil fields aging, how much capacity — if any — exists to raise production?

events.title: 'Sinners' breaks records at 2026 Oscar nominations
events.summary: The film by Ryan Coogler earned 16 nods for the 98th Academy Awards, which will be presented on March 15. A new Oscar category was also introduced for the first time in 25 years.

events.title: From Inuit to Vikings to Trump: The history of Greenland
events.summary: After being inhabited only by Indigenous peoples for centuries, the Arctic island saw the Vikings in the 10th century and the Danes in 1721, and it attracted US interest back in 1867.

events.title: UN backs boost in nature-saving business
events.summary: Global financing is heavily skewed to industries that harm rather than preserve nature, according to a new report that calls for an urgent scale-up of nature-positive spending.

events.title: Davos WEF: Trump touts policies, renews Greenland ambitions
events.summary: Donald Trump used his WEF speech to praise himself and lash out at Europe while offering little on the economy. Business and political leaders were expecting the worst, but much of it was for a domestic audience.

events.title: European Parliament votes to delay Mercosur deal in court
events.summary: Lawmakers voted narrowly to challenge the EU trade deal with Latin America in the bloc's top court, a move that could derail the deal. Chancellor Friedrich Merz said the deal should be provisionally enacted anyway.

events.title: Free solo climb on Netflix: 'If you fall, you're gonna die'
events.summary: Rock climber Alex Honnold plans to scale the facade of what was once the world's tallest building — live on Netflix. But not all are impressed by the idea.

events.title: Apple overtakes Samsung in phones sales worldwide
events.summary: After 14 years behind Samsung, Apple is back on top in global smartphone sales, just as Chinese rivals step up the pressure. Foldables and advanced AI are the new battleground in the fight for the next billion users.

events.title: WEF in Davos: Is Greenland the wake-up call Europe needed?
events.summary: Europe faces waning influence amid wars, trade tensions, climate inaction and a US administration quick to hurl insults at its oldest allies. In Davos, leaders discuss how Europe can regain its mojo.

events.title: Halabja Massacre: Survivors still haunted by chemical weapons strike
events.summary: Kurdish Iraqis who survived the 1988 chemical weapons attack on Halabja and nearby communities have lasting trauma, a new report finds, highlighting the need for long-term support.

events.title: How bringing back a humble algae to Arctic waters makes all the difference
events.summary: For decades, researchers in northern Norway had tried to bring back vital kelp forests after overfishing damaged marine ecosystems. Now a simple solution is proving successful.

events.title: Iran's economic woes expose regime's tight grip
events.summary: As religious elites and Revolutionary Guards strengthen their hold on the economy, experts question how long the regime can survive.

events.title: African fans fume at 'disgraceful' World Cup travel ban
events.summary: Senegal's football team are champions of Africa, but fans from the country are banned from going to the US for the World Cup. They aren't the only ones, with Donald Trump's hostility and FIFA ticket prices hitting hard.

events.title: Like potatoes? Berlin is giving away 4 million kilos
events.summary: As an initiative redistributes a bumper surplus of spuds, here's a look at the Germans' great love affair with the potato.

events.title: How can the EU respond to US 'blackmail' over Greenland?
events.summary: European leaders have three main options for responding to the Trump administration’s economic threats. If they don’t get it right, Trump may be emboldened to take over Greenland.

events.title: Meet Veronika, the clever cow with tools to scratch herself
events.summary: A cow in Austria has been observed using tools ― the first time such behavior has been recorded in cattle. Have we underestimated the gentle bovines all this time?

events.title: Why Germany probably won't get political at 2026 World Cup
events.summary: After their very public protest at the last World Cup in Qatar, Germany's football team looks unlikely to do the same in the United States in 2026.

events.title: 'Sentimental Value' sweeps European Film Awards. Next step, Oscars?
events.summary: Joachim Trier's drama won the top accolades, adding to the buzz ahead of the Oscar awards. Iran was also in the spotlight, with director Jafar Panahi decrying the government's brutal crackdown on protest.

events.title: WEF: Donald Trump set to dominate Davos 2026
events.summary: Weeks after attacking Venezuela, capturing its controversial leader, and reviving Greenland ambitions, the US president's presence in Davos is expected to raise the stakes at the WEF's annual meeting.

events.title: 8 fun facts about Dolly Parton for her 80th birthday
events.summary: Dolly Parton is one of the world's most successful artists. Now 80, she has an eventful life to look back over. Here are some important and extraordinary facts about the country music icon.

events.title: How European cinema is stealing Hollywood's spotlight
events.summary: As Hollywood doubles down on sequels, the contenders for the European Film Awards feature bold, political works that are challenging audiences and creating buzz far beyond the continent.

events.title: 2026 stargazing: Eclipses, meteor showers and supermoons
events.summary: 2026 will leave stargazers spoiled for sights in the sky, with four eclipse events, multiple meteor showers and several supermoons.

events.title: German firms hunker down as Trump marks one year in office
events.summary: One year into Donald Trump's second term, higher tariffs and sharper threats are straining transatlantic business. German companies in the US are weighing compliance against resistance as uncertainty grows.

events.title: Livestream: 4 award-winning filmmakers discuss risk-taking cinema
events.summary: DW co-hosts a talk with European Film Award and Oscar nominees Jafar Panahi, Oliver Laxe, Mascha Schilinski and Joachim Trier. Watch it live here.

events.title: NBA Europe to 'respect' European basketball tradition
events.summary: The NBA is pressing ahead with plans to launch a basketball league in Europe, with a slated launch date of 2027.

events.title: 'Charlie Hebdo' cartoon on Swiss fire tragedy sparks outrage
events.summary: A cartoon by the French satirical weekly portraying the deadly fire in Crans-Montana as the "comedy of the year" provokes disgust.

events.title: Women poised to take India sports to the next level
events.summary: India has been experiencing major growth in women's sports in recent years. This is being fuelled by investment from both the public and private sector – as well as many role models.

events.title: Wikipedia at 25: Of collective knowledge and its fault lines
events.summary: From utopian origins to AI-driven rivals, the "people's encyclopedia" has been shaped by debates over neutrality, expertise and the future of shared knowledge.

events.title: Louvre hikes ticket price for non-EU visitors by almost half
events.summary: The Louvre museum and several other French cultural sites are increasing the price of entry for visitors from outside Europe. So-called "dual pricing" is quite common in less wealthy countries but rare in richer regions.

events.title: International Space Station crew to make emergency return to Earth
events.summary: A medical emergency will force four astronauts aboard the International Space Station to return to Earth prematurely.

events.title: From the Monroe Doctrine to the Donroe Doctrine
events.summary: America for Americans: That was James Monroe's message to European colonial powers in 1823, to respect the independence of new nations of the Americas. Trump is reinterpreting this doctrine.

events.title: Australians are changing their response to wildfires
events.summary: DW's Stuart Braun had a dangerously near miss during Australia's 2009 "Black Saturday" inferno. As this month's fires burned near his rural home, he wasn't taking any chances.

events.title: Cannabis: Now you can measure how much is too much
events.summary: At what point does smoking weed get dangerous? A British study measured cannabis consumption in THC units and determined which amounts increase health risks. The system comes with clear risk thresholds ― and weaknesses.

events.title: Cheating scandal hits Winter Olympics skeleton qualifier
events.summary: An international sports governing body is investigating after a Canadian coach was accused of manipulating an event — depriving racers of qualifying points ahead of February's Winter Olympics.

events.title: Why Venus Williams and other sports stars are playing longer
events.summary: More than three decades after she burst onto the tennis scene, Venus Williams is still playing at the top level. Why are we seeing elite athletes carrying on into their 40s and beyond?

events.title: 2026 World Cup: Germany to be based at North Carolina hotel
events.summary: Germany will be making a hotel in Winston-Salem their base camp during next summer's World Cup. The choice of headquarters has been seen as key to the national team's success — or failure — at previous World Cups.

events.title: The impact of US withdrawal from global climate pacts
events.summary: The US has pledged to pull out of dozens of international organizations and treaties established to advance the protection of the planet. But it doesn't spell the end of environmental action.

events.title: What to watch out for as the Bundesliga resumes play
events.summary: Bayern Munich seem to have another Bundesliga title all but sealed. But could a serious challenger still emerge? And who is in danger of relegation? DW has you covered.

events.title: How clean energy could save us trillions
events.summary: As clean energy prices fall, a fast transition to renewable energy is the cheapest option on the table. Experts say it could save us trillions in energy costs alone.

events.title: Iran demands Oman venue for US talks as tensions rise in Middle East
events.summary: Iran has demanded that this week’s talks with the US be held in Oman rather than Turkey, with the agenda narrowed to nuclear issues only, a regional source said on Tuesday. The move adds new complications to an already delicate diplomatic effort amid heightened military tensions in the region.

events.title: Art teacher critically injured by student in southern France school stabbing
events.summary: A 14-year-old student in southern France stabbed an art teacher multiple times on Tuesday, leaving her in critical condition. Authorities said the attack appears linked to personal tensions, with no known political or religious motive, and the suspect has been arrested on suspicion of attempted murder.

events.title: Trump signs $1.2 trillion funding bill, ending government shutdown
events.summary: US President Donald Trump signed a sweeping $1.2 trillion government funding package to end a partial federal shutdown, while leaving unresolved a looming battle in Congress over short-term Homeland Security funding and immigration enforcement.

events.title: Petro and Trump strike conciliatory tone after year of tensions
events.summary: Colombian President Gustavo Petro and US President Donald Trump appeared to reset strained relations during a White House meeting, signalling cooperation on drug trafficking and trade after months of sharp rhetoric and diplomatic friction.

events.title: Lula tribute at Rio Carnival stirs political controversy ahead of elections
events.summary: A samba school’s decision to honour Brazilian President Inacio Lula da Silva at this year’s Rio de Janeiro Carnival has sparked controversy, with critics accusing organisers of turning the spectacle into a premature campaign event months before national elections.

events.title: Poland to probe possible links between Epstein and Russia, PM Tusk says
events.summary: Poland ​will launch an investigation into possible links between the late sex offender Jeffrey ⁠Epstein and Russian intelligence, as well as any impact on Poland, Prime Minister Donald Tusk said on Tuesday. "More and more leads, more ​and more information, and more and more commentary in the global press all relate to the suspicion that this unprecedented paedophilia scandal was co-organised by ‌Russian intelligence services," Tusk said.

events.title: Digital sovereignty: 'an opportunity to have technology serve society'
events.summary: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Sharon Gaffney, Martin Hullin, Director of the Network for Technological Resilience and Sovereignty at the Bertelsmann Stiftung, says that the US political coercion through big tech firms provides 'an opportunity for Europe to look into not only funding alternatives but actually strategising on how we would like to have technology serve societies and not the other way round'.

events.title: India says trade deal with US 'best in the region' but keeps mum on Russian oil
events.summary: Following a social media announcement by Donald Trump about a trade deal, Indian officials hailed the agreement as 'the best in the region' while making no explicit comment about the US president's claim that Prime Minister Narendra Modi had agreed to stop buying Russian oil. Moscow meanwhile says it hasn't heard from India about any plans to do so.  We take a closer look at how much crude oil India imports from Russia.

events.title: Ghana pauses passports for diaspora
events.summary: In tonight's edition, Ghana freezes its warm welcome to African diaspora would-be citizens as the government shakes up the application process. Also, cancer is one of the leading causes of death in Africa, and rates are projected to go up more on the continent than anywhere else. And a picturesque Tunisian town lives in constant fear of landslides after heavy rains washed away homes and left the ground beneath them uncertain.

events.title: Brazil’s missing children: Technology, community efforts race to recover thousands unaccounted for
events.summary: For this edition of VIEW FROM RIO, Carys Garland is pleased to welcome our Jan Onoszko. In Brazil, nearly 24,000 children and adolescents were reported missing in 2025. The figures represent not just a statistical spike, an 8% increase from the previous year, but a deeper, systemic challenge. In this edition, our correspondent explores how bureaucracy, broken systems, and social fault lines converge to keep thousands of young people at risk and families in anguish. The growing use of technology and community-driven efforts seek to reverse these trends.

events.title: Police raid Paris offices of Musk's X over child sexual deepfakes
events.summary: The Paris prosecutor's cybercrime unit raided the French offices of Elon Musk's social media platform X on Tuesday morning, as part of a probe into alleged offences including political interference, unlawful data extraction and sexualised deepfakes of women and children. Vedika Bahl goes through what we know so far, in Truth or Fake.

events.title: Iran 'does not have many cards to play with' ahead of talks this week, expert says
events.summary: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Mark Owen, Sina Azodi, Director of the Middle East Studies program at George Washington University and author of "Iran & the Bomb: United States, Iran &the Nuclear Question", says that 'Iranians since the June 2025 conflict do not have many cards to play with, the only leverage that they have is 400 kilos of highly-enriched uranium', ahead of talks scheduled for Friday this week.

events.title: Libya: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi killed in Zintan city by gunmen
events.summary: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, a son of Libya’s late longtime ruler Muammar Gaddafi and once seen as his heir, has died, relatives said Tuesday, without providing details on the circumstances. His death was confirmed by an adviser on social media, while his cousin told Libyan media he had been killed in his home in Zintan by unidentified men.

events.title: 'NATO could do so much more', Ukraine MP says as Russia resumes large-scale strikes
events.summary: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Mark Owen, Lisa Yasko, Ukrainian MP for President Zelelnskyy's party Sluga Narody Servant of the People, says that 'NATO could do so much more in terms of security'. NATO chief Mark Rutte said on a visit to Kyiv Tuesday that Russia's overnight attacks did not suggest Moscow was serious about making peace, as the United States pushes talks to stop the fighting.

events.title: US says shot down Iran drone that approached aircraft carrier in Arabian Sea
events.summary: A US stealth warplane shot down an Iranian drone that "aggressively" approached an American aircraft carrier as it sailed in the Arabian Sea on Tuesday, a US military spokesman said. The incident occurred with the carrier about 800 kilometers from Iran's coast, and came on the same day that American forces responded to Iranian boats that threatened to board a US-flagged tanker in the Strait of Hormuz. FRANCE 24's Reza Sayah reports from Tehran.

events.title: Never mind the bloodbath? Trump turns to direct talks with Iran over nukes
events.summary: One month after the US captured Nicolas Maduro, is Washington trying its Venezuela template on Iran? Not the part where special forces swoop for foreign leaders. Rather the part where the regime and its apparatus can stay so long as Washington gets what it wants. In the case of Iran, maximum pressure and Donald Trump’s initial promise to protesters that “help is on the way” seems to be morphing into art of the deal-style nuclear bargaining.

events.title: Pas de deux: Petro, Trump found a 'perfect sparring partner for their respective political agendas'
events.summary: François Picard is pleased to welcome Elizabeth Dickinson, Deputy Director for Latin America at the International Crisis Group. She offers a nuanced, clear-eyed perspective on the shifting dynamics between the United States and Colombia. Through the lens of US domestic politics, Colombia’s internal electoral cycle, and the regional impact of counternarcotics policy, Ms. Dickinson underscores how spectacle and substance often coexist.

events.title: Amid harsh winter, 'half of Gaza's residents are living in dilapidated tents'
events.summary: Despite the ceasefire in place in Gaza since October 2025, the Israeli bombing continues. Residents are suffering dire conditions while winter has made things worse: heavy rains have flooded the camps and cold weather has led to the death of at least ten children due to a lack of adequate heating or clothing. Local associations, such as The Sameer Project, are doing what they can to support Gaza’s residents.

events.title: French prosecutors seek 5-year ban from office for far-right leader Marine Le Pen in appeal trial
events.summary: French prosecutors urged on Tuesday an appeal court to uphold far-right leader Le Pen’s five-year ban from public office over an EU parliament fake jobs scandal, threatening her 2027 presidential bid.

events.title: Epstein files: UK's Mandelson to quit House of Lords
events.summary: Peter Mandelson is resigning from the House of Lords amid an investigation into his ties with Jeffrey Epstein. The British government is considering legislation to remove his noble title. Police are reviewing allegations that Mandelson shared sensitive information with Epstein, as revealed in recently released documents. Prime Minister Keir Starmer has ordered an urgent review of Mandelson's contacts with Epstein. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle has the details.

events.title: Ukraine: Kyiv residents face power outages amid Russian strikes
events.summary: In Kyiv, residents endure daily power outages due to relentless Russian strikes, making it difficult to cook or heat homes. These attacks have severely damaged Ukraine's power grid and infrastructure, including residential buildings and schools. NATO chief Mark Rutte visited Kyiv to express support, asserting that Russia's actions show a lack of commitment to peace. President Zelenskyy is preparing for talks with Russian negotiators in Abu Dhabi, emphasizing the need for security guarantees from Western partners.

events.title: UK ex-US ambassador Peter Mandelson quits House of Lords amid Epstein scandal
events.summary: Britain’s former US ambassador Peter Mandelson is stepping down from the House of Lords after fresh revelations over his ties to late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein as Prime Minister Keir Starmer said the veteran Labour figure had "let his country down" and police reviewed reports of his possible misconduct while in public office.

events.title: Digital sovereignty (2/3): Can Europe’s businesses survive without US Big Tech?
events.summary: Businesses in Europe are increasingly questioning their reliance on US technology amid fears that President Donald Trump might one day “pull the plug” on the continent. In part two of our series on digital sovereignty, we look at the dangers of European dependency on American Big Tech – and why decoupling from the US is easier said than done.

events.title: 'I still would like to meet Putin': Epstein's unrequited love for Russian leader
events.summary: What has Vladimir Putin got to do with Jeffrey Epstein?

events.title: US aircraft carrier scrambles fighter jet to down 'aggressive' Iranian drone
events.summary: A US fighter jet has shot down an Iranian drone that was flying "aggressively" towards an aircraft carrier, the US military has said.

events.title: At least 15 dead after migrant boat collides with Greek coastguard
events.summary: At least 15 people have been killed in a collision between a speedboat carrying migrants and a coastguard vessel off the coast of Greece,  authorities have said.

events.title: Teenage boy swims for four hours to save family swept out to sea
events.summary: A 13-year-old Australian boy has described battling "massive" waves to swim around four hours to shore and raise the alarm after his family were swept out to sea.

events.title: Air India flight from Heathrow grounded after 'possible defect' with fuel control switch
events.summary: A Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner, operated by Air India, has been grounded after reports of a "possible defect" with a fuel control switch on the same model of aircraft which crashed in Ahmedabad last June.

events.title: French investigators raid Paris offices of Elon Musk's X
events.summary: Investigators have raided the Paris offices of Elon Musk's social media site X, formerly known as Twitter.

events.title: Son of Norway's crown princess denies rape as trial begins
events.summary: The trial of the eldest son of Norway's crown princess on charges including rape has begun, after a set of new allegations were made against him.

events.title: Oscar-nominated screenwriter arrested in Iran days after criticising regime
events.summary: One of the screenwriters of an Oscar-nominated film has been arrested in Tehran days after signing a statement condemning Iranian leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei and his regime's violent crackdown on protesters.

events.title: Is Ronaldo on strike? The story behind 'unhappy' £500,000-a-day star's absence
events.summary: Cristiano Ronaldo appears to have gone on strike at his Saudi Arabian club.

events.title: World football chief issues apology to British fans after 'cheap joke'
events.summary: The president of world football's governing body FIFA has apologised to British football fans after a comment which was criticised as a "cheap joke" by the Football Supporters' Association.

events.title: Harper says Canada should make 'any sacrifice necessary' to preserve independence
events.summary: Former Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper says the country should make “any sacrifice necessary” to preserve the independence of the country in the face of threats from U.S. President Donald Trump

events.title: Ethiopia's prime minister accuses Eritrea of mass killings during Tigray war
events.summary: Ethiopian prime minister has accused Eritrea of mass killings while fighting alongside government troops against regional forces in the war in the troubled northern region of Tigray that ended in 2022

events.title: Syrian security forces continue to deploy in Kurdish areas under deal with SDF
events.summary: Security forces linked to Syria's Interior Ministry continued to deploy in Kurdish-majority areas in northeastern Syria, as part of an agreement between Damascus and the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces

events.title: Spain considers social media ban for under-16s, joining others in Europe
events.summary: Spain's prime minister says that his government plans to ban social media access for children under 16

events.title: Images show abandoned belongings and mock police stations at a former scam center in Asia
events.summary:
In the town of O’Smach, along Cambodia’s northern border with Thailand, stands a compound of abandoned buildings that were battered by shelling during recent weeks of armed clashes.

The site, now occupied by Thai troops, had served as one of Cambodia’s notorious scam centers, according to Thai officials.

A six-story building, shown to journalists and international observers on Monday during a trip organized by the Thai military, is scattered with documents, equipment and personal belongings, likely abandoned in haste.

“They are well-organized. They have good infrastructure and systems, and also the workflow and many, many tactics and techniques to do the scams,” said Lt. Gen. Teeranan Nandhakwang, director of the Thai army’s intelligence unit.

Experts say such scam operations in Cambodia and elsewhere have cheated people around the world out of billions of dollars and tricked people from many countries to work in them under slave-like conditions.

The Thai military said the...

events.title: Snowboarding's oldest competitor chases his first solo gold medal
events.summary: Four years after Nick Baumgartner won a snowboarding gold medal at age 40, he says he's a better athlete than ever, even in an Olympic sport dominated by youth.

events.title: Rory Guilday's long road from chemotherapy to the Olympics
events.summary: It was decision day for the best U.S. women’s hockey players, and Rory Guilday was cautiously confident despite being cut from the team a year earlier.

events.title: Savannah Guthrie Speaks Out on Missing Mom: 'Bring Her Home'
events.summary: Authorities are urgently asking the public for help with any tips related to the disappearance of Nancy Guthrie, the 84-year-old mother of Savannah Guthrie. As the search continues, investigators believe Guthrie was “taken from the home against her will” which could include “possible kidnapping or abduction.” Anyone with information is urged to contact the Pima County sheriff’s department at 520-351-4900. NBC’s Liz Kreutz reports and Tom Winter joins TODAY with analysis.

events.title: Ohtani says winning three-peat would be 'very cool'
events.summary: Two-time World Series champion and reigning NL MVP Shohei Ohtani speaks with Tom Llamas about the possibility of winning a third consecutive World Series title with the Los Angeles Dodgers.

events.title: AI bots communicate via new social networking site
events.summary: NBC News AI reporter Jared Perlo joins "Here's the Scoop" to discuss Moltbook — a new forum for AI bots to communicate.

events.title: Trump says he will call Savannah Guthrie about mother
events.summary: Trump says he will call Savannah Guthrie about mother

events.title: Jill Biden's ex-husband charged with killing current wife
events.summary: Jill Biden's ex-husband charged with killing current wife

events.title: U.S. and Iran may hold talks in Istanbul as Trump weighs military action
events.summary: Iran is ready to negotiate with the U.S. and is optimistic that a deal can be reached if the goal is to get to a place where the country has no nuclear weapons.

events.title: Paris prosecutors summon Elon Musk after raid on X's French offices
events.summary: Prosecutors in Paris said they asked Elon Musk to appear for questioning after searching X's offices in as part of a probe into sexual deepfakes.

events.title: Gay hockey drama 'Heated Rivalry' becomes a hit in Russia, but fandom could lead to prison
events.summary: Russian fans of “Heated Rivalry” could end up in prison if they display their love for the show, but the gay romance about two hockey players is a hit anyway.

events.title: 'We heard the call, we came running': Trump's NATO remarks have shaken allied veterans
events.summary: President Donald Trump partially walked back his claim that NATO troops in Afghanistan stayed "off the front lines," but veterans aren't likely to forget the remarks

events.title: Russians feel strain of Putin's war with mobile internet shutdowns
events.summary: Russians have put up with drone attacks, rising prices and a crackdown on free speech.

events.title: Babies out, fur babies in: Why young people in China are choosing pets over parenthood
events.summary: China is shrinking as more couples are making a conscious choice not to have babies, a challenge for President Xi Jinping's ambitions.

events.title: Teen swims for hours to save family swept out to sea
events.summary: Austin Appelbee, a 13-year-old boy, swam 2.5 miles to rescue his mother and two younger siblings after their family was swept out to sea off the coast of Australia. NBC News’ Jesse Kirsch has the details on the heroic rescue.

events.title: Why a 'crying horse' toy is going viral in China
events.summary: One factory worker accidentally turned a smiling horse plushie commemorating the Lunar New Year into one that's frowning, and inadvertently created a Chinese viral sensation. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer reports on the infatuation with the toy that has been dubbed “crying horse.”

events.title: Year of the sad horse: Factory mistake creates viral toy in China
events.summary: Ahead of the Lunar New Year, a red plush horse nicknamed the “crying horse” is going viral on Chinese social media because of a factory mistake. Despite the mistake, manufacturers continue to produce the frowning horse to keep up with demand, with one toy store owner saying it “fits the reality of modern working people.”

events.title: What to know about Elon Musk and China with Tesla's massive 'Gigafactory' in Shanghai
events.summary: Billionaire tech executive Elon Musk’s relationship with party leaders in China is in the spotlight as the trade war ramps up. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer reports on what this means for his popularity in the country.

events.title: Key Gaza border crossing reopens, a step forward in the Israel-Hamas ceasefire
events.summary: The Rafah border crossing between the Gaza Strip and Egypt partially reopened Monday, a significant step in the ceasefire between Israel and Hamas

events.title: Rafah crossing will open between Gaza and Egypt today
events.summary: A key border crossing between the Gaza Strip and Egypt is expected to partially open Monday, with Egyptian officials readying help for sick and injured Palestinians

events.title: Through carnage of the government crackdown, Iranian protesters looked to Trump
events.summary: Through the carnage of Iran’s violent protest crackdown, the one thought that kept P. going was that President Donald Trump was behind them.

events.title: Trump and Colombia's Gustavo Petro strike positive tone after a year of sniping at each other
events.summary: The two leaders have often clashed since Trump returned to office, including after the U.S. seized Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro. But their White House meeting appeared to go well.

events.title: Epstein emails bring scandal to Europe's elite, from Norway's crown princess to Britain's 'prince of darkness'
events.summary: A rare royal apology, resignations and allegations of leaked government intel: The release of new Epstein documents has provoked outrage and a demand for answers in Europe over ties between prominent figures and the disgraced financier.

events.title: U.S. military shoots down Iranian drone that approached aircraft carrier
events.summary: American forces shot down an Iranian drone Tuesday as it “aggressively” approached the USS Abraham Lincoln aircraft carrier in the Arabian Sea and appeared to have “unclear intent,” U.S.

events.title: Russia unleashes new attacks on freezing Ukraine a day before peace talks
events.summary: Russia fired around 450 long-range drones and 70 missiles at Ukraine in a major attack overnight targeting the country's power grid in freezing temperatures, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Tuesday

events.title: Former Prince Andrew should testify before Congress, U.K.'s Keir Starmer says as Epstein revelations mount
events.summary: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer has called on the former Prince Andrew to testify before Congress about his dealings with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: U.S. warns Iran over planned military drills close to American forces
events.summary: The United States warned Iran on Saturday over its plans to conduct live-fire drills close to U.S. forces in the region, as partners sought to de-escalate rising tensions between the two nations

events.title: Confusion in Kyiv and Moscow after Trump says Putin agreed to pause attacks for a week
events.summary: Confusion reigned about whether Russian President Vladimir Putin had agreed to halt strikes on Ukraine after President Donald Trump said he asked him to stop.

events.title: Iran ready for talks or war, foreign minister says as Trump weighs military action
events.summary: Pressure was building on Iran on Friday as President Donald Trump weighed a military strike on the Islamic Republic and the Treasury Department sanctioned several officials it said were responsible for the regime’s brutal crackdown on its own people.

events.title: Unnerved by Trump, U.S. allies are making nice with China
events.summary: Since the start of the year, as President Donald Trump has alienated U.S. allies with his attack on Venezuela, demands for control of Greenland and new tariff threats, their leaders have been reviving ties with another country: China.

events.title: Palestinians crowded into Gaza tents struggle to see a better future even as ceasefire progresses
events.summary: A key border crossing is set to reopen, the ceasefire is moving forward and the United States is imagining a gleaming new Gaza, but Palestinians in the devastated enclave are still struggling to simply survive

events.title: Russia faces a heavy price for limited gains in Ukraine war, death toll estimates suggest
events.summary: After nearly four years, the grinding war between Russia and Ukraine is approaching a staggering battlefield toll: nearly half a million dead and 1½ million wounded or missing across both sides

events.title: Trump warns Iran time for nuclear deal is running out, says U.S. armada is ready for 'violence'
events.summary: Time is running out for Iran to make a deal, President Donald Trump warned Wednesday, as he urged the Islamic Republic to negotiate on nuclear weapons or face the force of a “massive armada” of American ships.“Like with Venezuela, it is, ready, willing, and able to rapidly fulfill its mission, with speed and violence, if necessary,” Trump said in a post on Truth Social, adding that the fleet was “moving quickly, with great power, enthusiasm, and purpose.”
